actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Indian Affairs.
Committee on Indian Affairs. Hearings held. Hearings printed: S.Hrg. 102-488.
Committee on Indian Affairs. Ordered to be reported with an amendment favorably.
Committee on Indian Affairs. Reported to Senate by Senator Inouye with an amendment. With written report No. 102-176.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 260.
Passed Senate with an amendment by Voice Vote.
Received in the House.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.

actions.committee: House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs
actions.text: Ordered to be Reported.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs
actions.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Reported by the Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs. H. Rept. 102-321.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 189.
Mr. Miller (CA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Cleared for White House.
Measure Signed in Senate.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 102-180.

official_title: A bill to amend Public Law 93-531 (25 U.S.C. 640d et seq.) to reauthorize appropriations for the Navajo-Hopi Relocation Housing Program for fiscal years 1992, 1993, 1994, and 1995.
short_title: Navajo-Hopi Relocation Housing Program Reauthorization Act of 1991

summary.text: Navajo-Hopi Relocation Housing Program Reauthorization Act of 1991 - Amends Federal law to extend the authorization of appropriations for the Navajo-Hopi Relocation Housing Program from FY 1991 through 1995. Directs the Commissioner on Navajo and Hopi Relocation (Commissioner) serving at the end of a term to continue to serve until his or her successor has been confirmed. Requires that the Commissioner be compensated at the rate of basic pay payable for level IV of the Executive Schedule. Makes the powers of the Commissioner subject to the rules and regulations adopted by the Office of Navajo and Hopi Indian Relocation (Office). Prohibits the Commissioner from appointing or fixing the compensation of his or her staff and personnel in excess of a GS-15 position. Provides that nothing in this Act shall cause any employee of the Office to be separated or reduced in grade or compensation for 12 months after the enactment of this Act. Places the positions of Executive Director of the Office of Navajo and Hopi Indian Relocation and Deputy Executive Director of such Office in the Senior Executive Service. Considers any employee of such Office on the enactment of this Act to be a civil service employee as defined by Federal law.
